body.p: Jesse TG. Marlow States that he lives and did live at Bennetsville at the time Margolyes kept his tavern near this Town that the said Margolyes, had an entire sufficentcy of Good substantials for men and beasts, has kept a stable and I he and O. P. Spencer say that he had engaged Stable room of him, and heard also that he has of Saml Rice. I borrowed corn of Margolyes and also bought some, I also saw fodder at his tavern Stand, I have been frequently at his tavern and am of the opinion that he kept as orderly & decent a house as any house where drinking is allowed
Given under my hand this 21st November 1861
Ed Pate J. P. B. C.
